description.value:
Bone Rhythms
Minor Rite

Time: 1 bonus action
Cost: 1 Gnosis
Frequency: Once per long rest

Description

Bone Rhythms is a simple but ancient rite in which a Garou taps, drums, or clicks bone, stone, or claw in a steady pattern. The rhythm aligns the Garou's breath, heartbeat, and spirit, grounding them against the disorientation of the Umbra.

This Rite is not a prayer. It is remembering the beat of the world.

Effect

When this Rite is performed, it remains dormant until triggered.

Once before the end of your next long rest, when you fail a roll dealing with the Umbra, you may choose to reroll that roll and use the new result.

This may apply to:

  • Umbra Phasing rolls
  • Gnosis Rolls tied to Umbra interaction
  • Saving throws or checks made to resist Umbral effects
  • Storyteller-approved rolls directly involving the Umbra

You must accept the new result.

Limitations

This Rite:

  • Can only be used once per long rest
  • Must be declared after the failure but before the outcome is finalized
  • Cannot be used on attack rolls or damage rolls
  • You may have only one active Bone Rhythms effect at a time
